Class ViewPagerTitleExample.ArrayListFragment

java.lang.Object

All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener
Enclosing class:
ViewPagerTitleExample
public static class ViewPagerTitleExample.ArrayListFragment
extends android.support.v4.app.ListFragment

Subclass of ListFragment, used to display the different pages inside the ViewPager.

Simply shows a TextView with the name of the Page/Tab tabNames and a ListView with some static entries listStrings.

onCreateView

public android.view.View onCreateView(android.view.LayoutInflater inflater,
                                      android.view.ViewGroup container,
                                      android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
When creating, we retrieve this instance's page index from its arguments.

The Fragment's UI is just a simple text view showing its instance name as well as a ListView.

Overrides:
onCreateView in class android.support.v4.app.ListFragment

onActivityCreated

public void onActivityCreated(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
The last method that gets called during the creation of a fragment simply adds an adapter to the ListView using the listStrings array as content.
